Title: Benefits of Humility | Vachanamrut Gadhada I-58
English Content: ...by realizing, ‘All of these devotees are great; I am inferior compared to them all.’ Realizing this, he behaves as a servant of a servant of the devotees of God. All of the evil natures of a person who behaves in this manner are destroyed, and day by day, noble virtues such as gnān, vairāgya, bhakti, etc., continue to flourish within them.
Gujurati Content: . ..એમ જાણે જે, ‘એ સર્વ ભક્ત મોટા છે ને હું તો સર્વથી ન્યૂન છું,’ એમ જાણીને હરિભક્તનો દાસાનુદાસ થઈ રહે. અને એવી રીતે જે વર્તે તેના સર્વ વિકાર નાશ પામે અને તેને દિવસે દિવસે જ્ઞાન, વૈરાગ્ય, ભક્તિ આદિક જે શુભ ગુણ તે વૃદ્ધિ પામતા જાય છે.
Transliteration Content: ...em jāṇe je, ‘E sarva bhakta moṭā chhe ne hu to sarvathī nyūn chhu,’ em jāṇīne haribhaktano dāsānudās thaī rahe. Ane evī rīte je varte tenā sarva vikār nāsh pāme ane tene divase divase gnān, vairāgya, bhakti ādik je shubh guṇ te vṛuddhi pāmtā jāy chhe.

Title: Benefits of Humility | Purushottam Bolya Prite 9
English Content: The quality of humility is great. As long as there is life in the body, all should remain humble. One who has humility, patience and forgiveness is beyond the three bodies and three states.
Gujurati Content: નિર્માનીપણાનો ગુણ મોટો છે. ઘટમાં પ્રાણ હોય ત્યાં સુધી નિર્માનીપણું સૌએ રાખવું.... નિર્માનીપણું, ધીરજ અને ક્ષમા જેમાં હોય તે ત્રણ દેહ અને ત્રણ અવસ્થાથી પર થઈ ચૂક્યો.
Transliteration Content: Nirmānīpaṇāno guṇ moṭo chhe. Ghaṭmā prāṇ hoy tyā sudhī nirmānīpaṇu saue rākhvu. Nirmānīpaṇu, dhīraj ane kṣhamā jemā hoy te traṇ deh ane traṇ avasthāthī par thaī chūkyo.

Title: Benefits of Humility | Yogi Vani 10/9
English Content: Daspanu, or behaving as a servant, is a quality of God. Therefore, one should cultivate this virtue. If one imbibes this virtue, then one’s divyabhav increases and one understands all of the Satpurush’s actions to be divine.
Gujurati Content: દાસપણું એ ભગવાનનો ગુણ છે. માટે એવા ગુણ લાવવા શીખવું. એવો ગુણ આવે તો દિવ્યભાવ વધતો જાય અને મોટાપુરુષની સર્વે ક્રિયા અલૌકિક જ જણાય.
Transliteration Content: Dāspaṇu e Bhagawānno guṇ chhe. Māṭe evā guṇ lāvvā shīkhvu. Evo guṇ āve to divyabhāv vadhato jāy ane Moṭā Puruṣhnī sarve kriyā alaukikaj jaṇāy.

Title: Benefits of Humility | Bhaktachintamani, Prakaran 86
English Content:
One who stays in Satsang as a servant of servants; 
I enthusiastically accept the devotion of such a devotee.
Gujurati Content:
દાસના દાસ થઈને, વળી જે રહે સતસંગમાં; 
ભક્તિ તેની ભલી માનીશ, રાચીશ તેના રંગમાં.
Transliteration Content:
Dāsnā dās thaīne, vaḷī je rahe satasangmā; 
Bhakti tenī bhalī mānīsh, rāchīsh tenā rangmā.

Title: Benefits of Humility | Yogi Vani 8
English Content: Those who tolerate are humble. Don’t snap back with words. “If you insult me once then I’ll insult you twice.” Someone says, “You are like this, you are a fool.” One would tolerate such insults. They are humble. No matter how much power one acquires, one would keep it concealed. If a devotee becomes humble, they become worthy of God’s grace. Then God comes and stays within the devotee. If one walks upright (with a sense of ego) then one cannot acquire virtues.
Gujurati Content: ખમે એ નિર્માની. બે વેણ સામાં કહે એમ નહિ. “તું એક કહે તો હું લાખ કહું.” કોઈ કહે, “તું આવો, તારામાં અક્કલ નથી.” તો ખમી લે. એ નિર્માની. ગમે એટલાં ઐશ્વર્ય આવે તોપણ ઢાંકીને રહે. નિર્માની ભક્ત બને એટલે પાત્ર બને. પછી ભગવાન નિવાસ કરીને રહે. અટંટ રહે તો ગુણ ન આવે.
Transliteration Content: Khame e nirmānī. Be veṇ sāmā kahe em nahi. “Tu ek kahe to hu lākh kahu.” Koī kahe, “Tu āvo, tārāmā akkal nathī.” To khamī le. E nirmānī. Game eṭlā aishvarya āve topaṇ ḍhānkīne rahe. Nirmānī bhakta bane eṭle pātra bane. Pachhī Bhagwān nivās karīne rahe. Aṭanṭ rahe to guṇ na āve.

Title: Negative Effects of Ego | Kirtan - Sāmbhaḷ benī Hari rījhyāṇī rītḍī - Muktanand Swami
English Content: O sister, listen to me as I describe the means to please God. God has enmity with ego. All of one’s spiritual endeavors are instantly destroyed by ego, just as sweet milk becomes poisonous with one drop of snake venom.
Gujurati Content: સાંભળ બેની હરિ રીઝ્યાની રીતડી, મોહનવરને માન સંગાથે વેર જો; સાધન સર્વે માન બગાડે પળ વિષે, જેમ ભળિયું પયસાકરમાં અહિ-ઝેર જો…૧...સાંભળ
Transliteration Content:
Sāmbhaḷ benī Hari rījhyāṇī rītḍī,
 Mohanvarne mān sangāthe ver jo;
Sādhan sarve mān bagāde paḷ vishe,
 Jem bhaḷiyu paysākarmā ahi-jher jo... sāmbhaḷ
Source: Kirtan - Sāmbhaḷ benī Hari rījhyāṇī rītḍī - Muktanand Swami

Title: Instruction to Remain Humble | Vachanamrut Gadhada III-12
English Content: One who desires one’s own liberation should not harbor any form of vanity - such as, ‘I have been born in an upper-class family,’ or ‘I am wealthy,’ or ‘I am handsome,’ or ‘I am a scholar.’ One should not harbor this type of ego in one’s mind. In fact, even with a meek satsangi, one should behave as a servant of servants.
Gujurati Content: જેને પોતાનું કલ્યાણ ઇચ્છવું તેને કોઈ પ્રકારનું માન રાખવું નહીં જે, ‘હું ઉચ્ચ કુળમાં જન્મ પામ્યો છું કે હું ધનાઢ્ય છું કે હું રૂપવાન છું કે હું પંડિત છું.’ એવું કોઈ પ્રકારનું મનમાં માન રાખવું નહીં અને ગરીબ સત્સંગી હોય તેના પણ દાસાનુદાસ થઈ રહેવું.
Transliteration Content: Jene potānu kalyāṇ ichhvu tene koī prakārnu mān rākhvu nahī je, ‘Hu uchha kuḷmā janma pāmyo chhu ke hu dhanāḍhya chhu ke hu rūpvān chhu ke hu panḍit chhu.’ Evu koī prakārnu manmā mān rākhvu nahī ane garīb satsangī hoy tenā paṇ dāsānudās thaī rahevu.

Title: Instruction to Remain Humble | Purushottam Bolya Prite 13
English Content: Muktanand Swami explained Shri Hari’s nature, “In Satsang, Shri Hari would measure someone’s level in Satsang based on how much they were a das, or servant. Shri Hari would maintain affection for a devotee based on how much they behaved as a das.
Gujurati Content: મુક્તમુનિએ શ્રીહરિની સ્વાભાવિક પ્રકૃતિ કહી, “સત્સંગમાં દાસપણું જોઈને શ્રીહરિ જનોનો સત્સંગ નક્કી કરતા. હરિજનોમાં જેટલો દાસભાવ તેટલી તેની સાથે શ્રીહરિ પ્રીતિ રાખતા.
Transliteration Content: Muktamunie Shrī Harinī swābhāvik prakṛuti kahī, “Satsangmā dāspaṇu joīne Shrī Hari janono satsang nakkī kartā. Harijanomā jeṭlo dāsbhāv teṭlī tenī sāthe Shrī Hari prīti rākhtā.

Title: Instruction to Remain Humble | Swamini Vat 2/54
English Content: In Satsang, do not develop an understanding that all (satsangis) are equal and do not try to be equal (remain small in front of all). To understand others as equal as one is a great drawback.
Gujurati Content: સત્સંગમાં બરોબરિયાપણું સમજવું નહિ ને બરોબરિયા થાવું નહિ ને બરોબરિયા સમજવા એ જ ખોટ છે.
Transliteration Content: Satsangmā barobariyāpaṇu samajvu nahi ne barobariyā thāvu nahi ne barobariyā samajvā ej khoṭ chhe.

Title: Prasang
English Content:
1987 - Bochasan. As directed by Pramukh Swami Maharaj, Mahant Swami travelled across India and abroad to strengthen the satsang of devotees everywhere.
Once, in 1987, Mahant Swami returned to Bochasan at around 11pm. A youth who was accompanying him began to clean his room, while Swami went for a bath. After he had finished and was getting dressed, the youth went into the bathroom to rinse Mahant Swami’s wet clothes. But, when the youth emerged from the bathroom, he was stunned to see Mahant Swami performing dandvats in the direction of the bathroom. Surprised, the youth asked, “Swami, why are you performing dandvats towards the bathroom?”
Revealing his respect towards the youth, Mahant Swami replied, “You have observed a nirjala fast today, and also performed much physical seva. You have left your comforts in Mumbai and come... Yogi Bapa was always delighted to see the youths. So, I was offering dandvats to you!”
Today, that youth, now known as Pujya Anandvihari Swami, still emotionally recalls that occasion. Such is the glory and respect Mahant Swami has for all.
